definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: He's a good puncher but we're not going to stand in front of this guy and exchange with him.
sentences.chinese: 他是个优秀的打手，但我们将不会和他正面对攻的。

sentences.english: Harry Redknapp is expecting an open, attacking game against Villa in Saturday's potential cracker at the Lane.
sentences.chinese: 老雷期待在主场与维拉的关键对决中打一场对攻战。

sentences.english: The two negotiating parties began to attack each other because they held completely different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 由于意见不一致，谈判双方对攻了起来。

sentences.english: Anyway, we will arrive at Wednesday's really foundamental encounter in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 我们将在星期三的比赛做出很好的对攻战。

sentences.english: I think it will be an open game.
sentences.chinese: 我想这将是一场对攻战。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
